item.title:
RT by @Mappletons: Dynamicland's new website, documenting ten years of work, will be released tomorrow at http://dynamicland.org.
In the meantime, this video about Dynamicland's precursor gives some backstory and motivations. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uI7J3II59lc
item.dc:creator: @worrydream

item.title:
Who do I know in London building original AI products?
Apart from @meetgranola, @NustomSoftware, @tldraw, @humanloop
As in, the company is founded and based in London. Feels like this list should be longer.
item.dc:creator: @Mappletons

item.title:
Nobody will remember: - your salary - how ‚Äúbusy‚Äù you were - how many hours you worked
People will remember: - how many hot AI takes you had - which hot AI takes got you premium likes - if you forced others to have hot AI takes
item.dc:creator: @Mappletons
item.description:
Nobody will remember:
- your salary
- how ‚Äúbusy‚Äù you were
- how many hours you worked

People will remember:
- how many hot AI takes you had
- which hot AI takes got you premium likes
- if you forced others to have hot AI takes

item.title:
If I was giving out barefoot developer awards, @supabase‚Äôs http://postgres.new would be getting one üèÜ
Prompt your way to a database, see all the SQL commands it ran, plus visual diagram. And all stored locally in the browser with IndexedDB.
item.dc:creator: @Mappletons

item.title: R to @Mappletons: Full podcast episode here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p5P39HoCc5o
item.dc:creator: @Mappletons

item.title: *Loved* talking to @schickling about barefoot developers and local-first software. I only became interested in local-first this year, but was quickly convinced this is how we should build software. So many important connections between enabling local data and enabling local software cultures.
item.dc:creator: @Mappletons
item.description:
*Loved* talking to @schickling about barefoot developers and local-first software.
I only became interested in local-first this year, but was quickly convinced this is how we should build software.
So many important connections between enabling local data and enabling local software cultures.

nitter.privacydev.net/localfirstfm/status/1823325649479639426#m

item.title: My one weird gripe with everyone using Substack is every newsletter looks the same. It's like everyone showing up with the same face or speaking in the same monotone voice. I can't tell them apart. I forget whose words I'm reading. Sure, I care more about visual design, distinction, and character than others. But it honestly affects my ability to read and remember the material.
item.dc:creator: @Mappletons
item.description:
My one weird gripe with everyone using Substack is every newsletter looks the same.
It's like everyone showing up with the same face or speaking in the same monotone voice. I can't tell them apart. I forget whose words I'm reading.
Sure, I care more about visual design, distinction, and character than others. But it honestly affects my ability to read and remember the material.

item.title:
Started my new role as a lead design engineer at Normally @normallystudio this week üéâ
They're a small London studio focused on mindful, applied AI. Lots of internal R&D. The whole team is some kind of hybrid, so I fit right in. Excited to build here. https://normally.com/
item.dc:creator: @Mappletons

item.title: R to @Mappletons: Will say more about where I'm moving later! Joining a team based here in London üá¨üáß Still working in AI prototyping and interface design, but moving to a place where I hopefully have more designers around for support and mentorship. And can do more research / exploratory work.
item.dc:creator: @Mappletons
item.description:
Will say more about where I'm moving later!
Joining a team based here in London üá¨üáß
Still working in AI prototyping and interface design, but moving to a place where I hopefully have more designers around for support and mentorship. And can do more research / exploratory work.

item.title:
Some bittersweet news. I've moved on from Elicit.
I still love the team and product, and hope they do fantastically.
But living a split life in between London and San Francisco wasn't working for me. Solo, remote designer is a tough job.
https://maggieappleton.com/leaving-elicit
item.dc:creator: @Mappletons
item.description:
